Docs.summary: Defines an interface that a control designer can implement to provide access to a data source.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A class that is able to provide a data source can implement this interface to enable access to its data source by objects that use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceProvider> interface. This interface is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataFieldConverter> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataMemberConverter> classes.
## Examples The following code example shows a custom class, named `TemplatedListDesigner`, which inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner> class and implements the `IDataSourceProvider` interface.

Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the selected data source from the data source provider.
Docs.returns: The currently selected data source object of this data source provider.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example implements both the `GetSelectedDataSource` and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceProvider.GetResolvedSelectedDataSource%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceProvider> interface. The `GetSelectedDataSource` method is used to ensure that the data source associated with the control at design time is an object that implements the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface. This allows users to iterate through the data source.
[!code-xml[System.Web.UI.Design_Samples1#17](~/samples/snippets/common/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.web.ui.design_samples1/Common/System.Web.UI.Design_Samples1.xml#17)]
